content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Perfect for assessing algorithmic and probabilistic skills.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I had no difficulties with solving this problem, so the description and test cases were sufficient. There are other problems dealing with the outcome of combat between units, but the ones I'm aware of had no probabilistic component, making this original. It's probably a little on the easier side for a "Moderate" difficulty puzzle, but that's probably OK. Good job!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun probability challenge that requires careful handling of conditionals. The math is simple enough to calculate but tricky to implement.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
Please mention the order of output: attacker first or defender first?

Hi,

I don't understand the rounding method being used when the decimal part is 5
In Rifleman vs Shaman (test) we get 12.5 (0.5*0.5*0.5) that gets rounded to 13
In Rifleman vs Shaman (validator) we get 24.5 (0.5*0.7*0.7) that gets rounded to 24

It's not half even or half odd or half up or half down, ...

Goal
* Please change the following:
  • "Damage of each blow" to "Damage of each successful blow".

  • "develops as the following" to "proceeds as follows".

  • "launch" to "launches" (2 times).

  • "depending of" to "depending on".

  • "the change to hit" to "the chance to hit".

  • "if he has blows at all" to "if it has any blows remaining", *and* delete the brackets.

  • "get out of blows" (the first time) to "run out of blows".

  • "get out of blows" (the second time) to "runs out of blows".

  • "gets out of blows" to "also runs out of blows".

  • "his 3 other" to "its 3 other".
  
  • "As" to "The sequence goes like this".

  • "i.e." to "e.g.".

  • "1 blows" to "1 blow".

  • "probability of hitting" to "probability of successfully hitting".

  • "oponent" to "opponent".
  
  • "If this happens" to "If a hit is successful".
  
  • "subtracted from hp" to "subtracted from the opponent's hp".
  
  • "it gets reduced to 0 or less hitpoints" to "its hit points get reduced to 0 or less".

* Consider *not* formatting the whole example in bold. Only important points should be highlighted in bold.

Input
* Both Line 1 and Line 2 mention "attacker". There is no defender.

Output
* Please mention the order of output: attacker first or defender first?

* Consider including name0 and name1 in the output while splitting the output into two lines.

Constraints
* Please change the upper limits to reflect the actual range of input values covered in the existing cases:
  • hp0 and hp1: 100 (see also the final point below).
  • blows0 and blows1: 10.

Cases
* Please delete trailing newlines in the input:
  • Wounded Heavy infantry vs Light infantry v
  • A harmless fight (test)

* The validators can be a bit more different from the corresponding tests so that the outputs aren't always the same.

* A harmless fight v (validator): Please change the case so that hp0 and hp1 don't exceed 100. Having only a single case with HP over 100 doesn't add meaningful value. Alternatively, modify other cases to have a more balanced coverage and variety of hp values.

Thanks.

Many thanks for the patience reviewing my English.

I changed almost everything:

"if he has blows at all": here the meaning was that the defender can have total of 0 blows.  I tried to rephrase it more clearly.

I kept the output because I think it's simpler. I added unit names to help debugging, and also give a bit of color and a hint of what are the stats like.

I changed some of the validators. However I try to make them very similar because it would be frustrating to fall in a validator that is not covered by the tests.

Hmmm,,,

For most calculations (all of the tests, most of the validators) I checked manually, for some of them I actually used the code.

Here it seems that I took the calculated  it's because of the floating point representation.

```
> 0.5*0.7*0.7
0.24499999999999997

```

This seems dangerous, as I think we could get different results in different machines or languages.

I will review the tests to try to avoid rounding on 0.5 , which is annoying because they are most of them.

Thanks.

hm?

In the output section says:


> Output
> Line 1 : Space separated probabilities, first the attacker, then the defender, in percentage rounded to the nearest integer.

Thank you. I have problems to asses the difficulty of my own puzzles, since I know hte solution when I plan them.

It seems I cannot edit the difficulty now, anyway, I hope it's okay.
thank you, you made me very happy this morning!

Done, I adjusted all the cases to avoid rounding on 0.5.

Thanks for the point.
Hi cedricdd , as the issue is gone, would you consider upvoting?

Thank you for your quick follow-up and feedback.

Goal
* Please change the following:
  • "develops as the following" to "proceeds as follows".

  • "he has" to "it has".
  
  • "at least one blow" to "at least one blow remaining".

  • "gets out of blows" to "also runs out of blows".
  
  (Alternatively, if you don't want to repeat "runs out of blows", you may write, "If one of them exhausts all of its blows, the opponent continues hitting until it also runs out of blows.")

Cases
* I completely agree that validators should closely match the tests. That said, small changes, like tweaking toHit values, can help ensure the outputs differ without significantly altering the case. For example, in "Light infantry vs Heavy infantry v", you could revise the input to:

light 41 3 45 12
heavy 31 2 35 23

Please revise the following validators accordingly, as they currently expect the same outputs as their corresponding tests:
  • Light infantry vs Heavy infantry v
  • Light infantry vs wounded Heavy infantry v
  • Wounded Heavy infantry vs Light infantry v

Thanks again.

"at least one blow remaining"

What I want to say is not "remaining". There are units with 0 blows (see archer vs swordsman). Without the "if" in this case the description wouldn't fit.

I tried to rephrase it one more time. Hopefully is easier to understand now.

---

I took care of the rest.
Thank you very much, would you consider upvoting?
